monster.name: Adranach
monster.languages: understands the languages spoken by its creator but can't speak
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Arcane Leak
trait.text: When the adranach is reduced to half its hit point maximum (85 hit points), its mithral mask cracks and its arcane form begins to waver, creating a field of unstable magic around it. Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the adranach or enters that area for the first time on a turn takes 10 (3d6) radiant damage. Additionally, if a creature casts a spell within this area, it must make a DC 14 ability check using its spellcasting ability. On a failure, the spell backfires, consuming the spell slot and dealing 3 (1d6) force damage to the caster for each level of the spell slot that was consumed.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The adranach is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The adranach has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The adranach's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Powerful Build
trait.text: The adranach counts as one size larger when determining its carrying capacity and the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The adranach makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, one target, reach 5 ft. Hit: 32 (4d12 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Force Bolts (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The adranach targets up to four creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 28 (8d6) force damage.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 224

monster.name: Ashari Firetamer

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The firetamer is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, mending, produce flame (2d8) • 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, faerie fire, jump • 2nd level (3 slots): flame blade, heat metal, lesser restoration • 3rd level (3 slots): daylight, dispel magic, protection from energy • 4th level (3 slots): freedom of movement, wall of fire • 5th level (1 slot): conjure elemental

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

action.name: Flamecharm (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The firetamer can cast the dominate monster spell (save DC 15) on a fire elemental or other elemental fire creature. If the creature has 150 or more hit points, it has advantage on the saving throw.

action.name: Flameform (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The firetamer can transform into a fire elemental. Its game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the elemental, but the firetamer retains its alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, and all of its skill and saving throw proficiencies. While in this form, the firetamer can't cast spells. When the firetamer is reduced to 0 hit points, falls unconscious, or dies in this form, it reverts to its humanoid form. It can remain in flameform for up to 5 hours or until it reverts to its humanoid form as a bonus action.

action.name: Druidic Recovery (Bonus Action)
action.text: If the firetamer is in fire elemental form using Flameform, it can expend a spell slot to regain 1d8 hit points per level of the spell slot expended.

monster.spells: druidcraft, mending, produce flame, cure wounds, faerie fire, jump, flame blade, heat metal, lesser restoration, daylight, dispel magic, protection from energy, freedom of movement, wall of fire, conjure elemental
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 226

monster.name: Ashari Skydancer

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the skydancer is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the skydancer instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The skydancer doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Skysail
trait.text: The skydancer flies with a special Ashari magic item called a skysail (see page 199). While the skysail's wings are extended, the skydancer can glide through the air at a speed of 60 feet, but must descend by at least 10 feet at the end of its turn and can't gain altitude.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The skydancer is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): guidance, shillelagh • 1st level (4 slots): entangle, fog cloud, jump • 2nd level (2 slots): gust of wind, pass without trace

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skydancer makes two skysail staff attacks.

action.name: Skysail Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the skydancer makes this attack while flying, the target must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Fly (1/Day)
action.text: The skydancer uses its skysail to cast fly on itself for up to 1 minute (no concentration required).

reaction.name: Slow Fall
reaction.text: When the skydancer takes falling damage, it can reduce the damage by half.

monster.spells: guidance, shillelagh, entangle, fog cloud, jump, gust of wind, pass without trace
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 227

monster.name: Ashari Stoneguard

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The stoneguard is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, resistance • 1st level (4 slots): goodberry, speak with animals, thunderwave • 2nd level (2 slots): hold person, spike growth

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The stoneguard makes three granite maul attacks.

action.name: Granite Maul
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the attack hits, the stoneguard can also immediately cast thunderwave as a bonus action. This casting uses a spell slot but requires no components.

reaction.name: Sentinel
reaction.text: When a creature within 5 feet of the stoneguard attacks a target other than the stoneguard, the stoneguard can make one attack against that creature.

reaction.name: Skin to Stone
reaction.text: When the stoneguard is attacked, it gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks until the end of the attacker's turn.

monster.spells: druidcraft, resistance, goodberry, speak with animals, thunderwave, hold person, spike growth
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 229

monster.name: Ashari Waverider

trait.name: Healing Tides
trait.text: Whenever the waverider casts a spell of 1st level or higher that affects a nonhostile creature, that creature regains 3 hit points (in addition to any healing the spell may provide).

trait.name: Marine Empathy
trait.text: The waverider can speak with and understand aquatic plants and animals.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The waverider is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, poison spray (2d12), resistance • 1st level (4 slots): create or destroy water, cure wounds, healing word • 2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, lesser restoration, moonbeam • 3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals (aquatic beasts only), water breathing, water walk • 4th level (1 slot): control water

action.name: Harpoon
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength contest against the waverider or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the waverider. Attacks with this weapon made while underwater do not have disadvantage.

reaction.name: Fishform (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reaction.text: The waverider can transform into a hunter shark or a giant octopus. Its game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the chosen creature, but the waverider retains its alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It also retains its skill proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature it transforms into. When the waverider is reduced to 0 hit points, falls unconscious, or dies in this form, it reverts to its humanoid form. It can remain in fishform for up to 3 hours or until it reverts to its humanoid form as a bonus action.

monster.spells: druidcraft, poison spray, resistance, create or destroy water, cure wounds, healing word, animal messenger, lesser restoration, moonbeam, conjure animals, water breathing, water walk, control water
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 230

monster.name: Blighted Sapling

trait.name: Armor Class
trait.text: 10 + PB (natural armor)

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: twice your druid level

trait.name: Proficiency Bonus (PB)
trait.text: equals your bonus

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: When you reach 14th level in this class, the blighted sapling makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2d4 + PB piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 172

monster.name: Centaur Skeleton

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The centaur skeleton makes two attacks: one with its pike and one with its hooves, or two with its longbow.

action.name: Pike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 256

monster.name: Champion Of Ravens
monster.save: Str +5, Dex +15, Con +5, Int +13, Wis +5, Cha +6
monster.languages: Abyssal, Celestial, Common, Druidic, Elvish, thieves' cant

trait.name: Assassinate
trait.text: During his first turn, the Champion has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the Champion scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Aura of Protection
trait.text: While the Champion is conscious, he and friendly creatures within 10 feet of him have a +3 bonus to saving throws (included above).

trait.name: Eternal Champion
trait.text: When the Champion is reduced to 0 hit points or dies, his body is destroyed but his spirit returns to the Raven Queen's side, and he gains a new body after 1d4 days.

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the Champion is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

trait.name: Fate-Touched (4/Day)
trait.text: When the Champion makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, he can reroll the d20 and use either roll. Alternatively, when a creature the Champion can see makes an attack roll against him, or a saving throw against one of his spells or features, he can force that creature to reroll the attack or save and use the new roll.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The Champion's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (+10 to hit with spell attacks, save DC 18). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: bane, bless, druidcraft • 1/Day: greater invisibility

trait.name: Shadow Smite (1/Turn)
trait.text: The Champion deals an extra 49 (14d6) radiant or necrotic damage (his choice) when he hits a target with a weapon attack and he doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Unerring Sight
trait.text: The Champion's ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover and have no range penalty.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: The Champion wears boots of haste (see page 194) and the Deathwalker's Ward (see page 204), and wields Whisper (see page 211).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Champion makes three attacks with Whisper.

action.name: Whisper
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d4 + 8) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) psychic damage. On a critical hit, the target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the Champion for 1 minute. On a ranged attack, the Champion can teleport with Whisper, appearing within 5 feet of the target on a hit, or in a random space within 30 feet of the target on a miss.

action.name: Touch of Life and Death (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The Champion touches a creature within 5 feet of him, and chooses to either heal or harm that creature, restoring 55 (10d10) hit points or dealing 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. If the creature is an unwilling target, it can avoid either effect with a successful DC 20 Dexterity saving throw.

action.name: Cunning Action (Bonus Action)
action.text: The Champion takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

action.name: Boots of Haste (1/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The Champion clicks his heels together, casting haste on himself. He doesn't suffer from lethargy when the spell ends.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The Champion halves the damage that he takes from an attack that hits him. He must be able to see the attacker.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 275

monster.name: Cinderslag Elemental
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Searing Presence
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the elemental takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

trait.name: Molten Form
trait.text: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage and must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be restrained. A creature that starts its turn restrained in this way takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, freeing itself on a success.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
trait.text: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d10) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Molten Gaze
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or have one nonmagical item of the elemental's choice that the target is carrying instantly melt or burn to cinders.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 231

monster.name: Clasp Cutthroat

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
trait.text: The cutthroat deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the cutthroat that isn't incapacitated and the cutthroat doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cutthroat makes two shortsword or dagger attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Cunning Action (Bonus Action)
action.text: The cutthroat can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The cutthroat halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The cutthroat must be able to see the attacker.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 232

monster.name: Clasp Enforcer

trait.name: Intimidating Presence
trait.text: Whenever the enforcer hits a creature with a melee attack, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the enforcer until the end of the target's next turn. The enforcer and its allies have advantage on attack rolls against any creature frightened in this way. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the enforcer's Intimidating Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: As a bonus action, the enforcer can regain 12 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The enforcer makes three warhammer attacks.

action.name: Warhammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The enforcer regains 12 hit points.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 233

monster.name: Cobalt Golem
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
monster.immune: fire, lightning, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Conductive Body
trait.text: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage. Instead, its weapon attacks deal an extra 11 (2d10) lightning damage until the end of its next turn. Also until the end of the golem's next turn, any creature that touches it or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) lightning damage.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The golem makes two attacks: one with its slam and one with its sword, or it uses its Magnetic Pulse and then its Spinning Cleave.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) slashing damage.

action.name: Spinning Cleave
action.text: The golem makes a sword attack against each creature within 10 feet of it.

action.name: Magnetic Pulse (Recharge 6)
action.text: The golem raises its arms and unleashes a magnetic pulse. All unattended metal objects within 30 feet of it are pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the golem. Each creature wearing metal armor or made of metal within 30 feet of the golem must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the golem, then fall prone.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 240

monster.name: Cold Snap Spirit
monster.resist: slashing and piercing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Sense Heat
trait.text: The cold snap spirit can sense heat within 60 feet of it.

trait.name: Frozen Aura
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a cold snap spirit takes 5 (1d10) cold damage.

trait.name: Jealous Spirit
trait.text: If the spirit attacks a creature that is within 5 feet of another cold snap spirit, the attack deals an extra 10 (3d6) cold damage on a hit.

action.name: Consume Warmth
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) cold damage, and the target's speed is halved until the end of the spirit's next turn.

action.name: Subzero Wave (1/Day)
action.text: Each creature within 30 feet of the cold snap spirit must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 234

monster.name: Cyclops Stormcaller
monster.ac: 18 (chain mail, cloak of protection, ring of protection)
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., fly 60 ft. (stormy conditions only)
monster.save: Str +5, Dex +2, Con +6, Int +4, Wis +5, Cha +11

trait.name: One-Eyed
trait.text: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

trait.name: Storm Wings
trait.text: While outdoors in stormy conditions, the cyclops has a flying speed of 60 feet.

trait.name: Supernatural Focus
trait.text: The cyclops has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on spells, and cannot lose concentration because of turbulent weather.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The cyclops's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The cyclops can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: ray of frost (3d8), water walk • 3/Day each: ice storm, sleet storm, wind wall • 1/Day each: control weather, storm of vengeance

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cyclops makes two ice claw attacks.

action.name: Ice Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

monster.spells: ray of frost, water walk, ice storm, sleet storm, wind wall, control weather, storm of vengeance
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 235

monster.name: Demonfeed Spider

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spider makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger; or the spider can make one attack with its web spinner followed by a melee attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 27 (6d8) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. If this poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

action.name: Stinger
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Web Spinner
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 40 ft., one target. Hit: The target is pulled 40 feet toward the spider and is grappled (escape DC 14). The spider can grapple only one creature at a time in this way. As an action, the spider can cocoon a creature it has grappled in webbing, causing it to be restrained and ending the grappled condition.

reaction.name: Arterial Spray
reaction.text: When the spider takes damage while below half its hit point maximum, it can spray poisonous blood in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 13 (3d8) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. If this poison damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the creature is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 237

monster.name: Demonfeed Spiderling

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The spiderling can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The spiderling ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 237

monster.name: Doty X
monster.languages: understands the languages that Tary speaks

trait.name: Arcane Surge (4/Day)
trait.text: When Doty hits a target, Tary can channel magical energy to deal an extra 14 (4d6) force damage to the target as long as Tary is not incapacitated.

trait.name: Dedicated Servant
trait.text: Doty has an additional 20 hit points, and has a +2 modifier to saving throws, ability checks using skill proficiencies, and attack rolls.

trait.name: Limited Vocabulary
trait.text: Doty can say the following words in Common: "Tary," "Yes," "Correct," "Absolutely," "Soon," and "Handsome."

trait.name: Vigilant
trait.text: Doty can't be surprised.

action.name: Empowered Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) force damage.

action.name: Repair (3/Day)
action.text: Doty regains 15 (2d8 + 6) hit points.

reaction.name: Deflect
reaction.text: If a creature within 5 feet of Doty that he can see makes an attack against a creature other than Doty, he can impose disadvantage on the attack roll. The attacker then takes 6 (1d4 + 4) force damage.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 272

monster.name: Ember Roc

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The roc has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Searing Presence
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the roc takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The roc sheds bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) piercing damage and 7 (2d6) fire damage.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) slashing damage and 7 (2d6) fire damage.

action.name: Inferno (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The roc beats its wings, creating a swirling conflagration. Each creature within 30 feet of the roc must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 21 (6d6) fire damage.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 238

monster.name: Flaming Skeleton
monster.languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Heated Weapons
trait.text: When the skeleton hits with a metal melee weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The skeleton sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage and 3 (1d6) fire damage.

action.name: Ignite
action.text: The skeleton flings itself at a Large or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 12). On a failed save, the target also takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns, even after the grapple ends. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to put out the flames, or if some other effect douses the flames (such as the target being submerged in water), the effect ends.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 256

monster.name: Forge Guardian
monster.immune: fire, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Fire Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the guardian is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The guardian is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The guardian's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The guardian makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Runeblade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until it deals damage to the guardian.

action.name: Kick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (2d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed up to 15 feet away from the guardian and knocked prone.

action.name: Bladestorm (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The guardian makes a Runeblade attack against every creature within 15 feet of it. On a hit, a target is also pushed up to 15 feet away from the guardian and knocked prone.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The guardian can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The guardian regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Runeblade
legendary.text: The guardian makes one Runeblade attack.

legendary.name: Kick
legendary.text: The guardian makes one Kick attack.

legendary.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The guardian moves up to 50 feet without triggering opportunity attacks, and can pass through other creature's spaces. Each creature whose space the guardian passes through must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 23 (2d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. Any creature that shares the guardian's space when it stops this movement is pushed out of its space into the nearest unoccupied space.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 241

monster.name: Grog Strongjaw
monster.languages: speaks Common, Dwarvish, and Giant with limited reading and writing

trait.name: Brutal Critical
trait.text: When Grog scores a critical hit, he rolls double weapon damage dice as usual, then rolls 3 additional weapon damage dice.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
trait.text: Grog has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Melee Master
trait.text: Grog can take a -5 penalty to any melee attack roll to gain a +10 bonus to the damage roll.

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of his turn, Grog can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

trait.name: Relentless Rage
trait.text: If Grog is reduced to 0 hit points while raging, he drops to 1 hit point instead if he succeeds on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Grog wears a belt of dwarvenkind. He wields the Bloodaxe (a +2 magic weapon), a dwarven thrower, and the Titanstone Knuckles (see page 211).

trait.name: Spellbreaker
trait.text: When Grog damages a creature that is concentrating on a spell, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw to maintain its concentration. In addition, Grog has advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet of him.

trait.name: Toughness
trait.text: Grog has an additional 40 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Grog makes two attacks (three when raging) with his Bloodaxe, dwarven thrower, or Titanstone Knuckles.

action.name: Bloodaxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (1d12 + 14) slashing damage and 3 (1d6) necrotic damage. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points, Grog gains 10 temporary hit points.

action.name: Dwarven Thrower
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. Hit:24 (2d8 + 15) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Titanstone Knuckles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (1d4 + 12) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Long Rest)
action.text: Grog casts enlarge/reduce on himself to grow in size for 10 minutes. While enlarged in this way, he has resistance to cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage.

action.name: Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text:
Grog enters a rage that lasts until he falls unconscious or chooses to end it (no action required). While raging, Grog gains the following benefits:
He has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
• He deals an extra 4 damage when he hits a target with a melee weapon attack (included in attacks)
• He has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage
• He can't be charmed or frightened
• He can make an additional melee weapon attack(included in the Multiattack action) When Grog's rage ends, he gains one level of exhaustion.

reaction.name: Opportunist
reaction.text: When a creature within 5 feet of Grog casts a spell or deals damage to him, Grog can make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 261

monster.name: Jourrael, The Caedogeist
monster.resist: acid, fire, lightning, cold, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: frightened, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: Jourrael can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. They take 5 (1d10) force damage if they end their turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
trait.text: Jourrael deals an extra 35 (10d6) damage when they hit a target with a weapon attack and have advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Jourrael that isn't incapacitated and Jourrael doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
Jourrael's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: dancing lights • 1/Day each: darkness, faerie fire

trait.name: Inevitable
trait.text: If Jourrael is reduced to 0 hit points, they do not fall unconscious but become an incorporeal spirit for 24 hours. During this time, Jourrael can't return to their original form until they return to full hit points. In this form, they are invisible, can't attack or interact with corporeal creatures or objects, and can't be targeted by spells. After 24 hours have passed, Jourrael regains 1 hit point and returns to their original form with four levels of exhaustion.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Jourrael makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Spectral Blade
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d6 + 7) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour.
If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

action.name: Void Dagger
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d4 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Cunning Action (Bonus Action)
action.text: Jourrael can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

action.name: Mirrored Form (Recharges after a Short Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Jourrael manifests three illusory duplicates that hover in her space. Each time a creature targets Jourrael with an attack, roll a d20 to see if it hits one of the duplicates. If there are three duplicates, a duplicate is targeted on a roll of 6 or higher. With two duplicates, a duplicate is targeted on a roll of 8 or higher. A single duplicate is targeted on a roll of 11 or higher. A duplicate's AC is 17, and it is destroyed if hit. Jourrael can hide the duplicates as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Jourrael adds 5 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them. To do so, they must see the attacker.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 245

monster.name: Keyleth, Voice of The Tempest
monster.save: Str +4, Dex +4, Con +5, Int +10, Wis +13, Cha +4

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Keyleth has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Focused
trait.text: Keyleth has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on spells.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Keyleth wears a circlet of wisdom (which increases her Wisdom score by 2), +2 leather armor, and a ring of protection with a +2 bonus. She wields the Spire of Conflux (see page 209).

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Keyleth is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 22, +14 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following druid spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, guidance, mending • 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, faerie fire, fog cloud, healing word, thunderwave • 2nd level (3 slots): alter self (at will), flaming sphere, gust of wind, pass without trace • 3rd level (3 slots): call lightning, wind wall • 4th level (3 slots): blight, control water, grasping vine, polymorph, stone shape • 5th level (3 slots): conjure elemental, greater restoration, scrying, wall of stone • 6th level (2 slots): heroes' feast, move earth, transport via plants • 7th level (2 slots): fire storm, plane shift • 8th level (1 slot): control weather • 9th level (1 slot): foresight, shapechange

action.name: Shapechange
action.text: Keyleth casts shapechange to transform into a planetar, an adult bronze dragon, or another creature of CR 20 or lower that is not a construct or undead.

action.name: Meteor (Earth Elemental Form Only)
action.text: When Keyleth falls at least 20 feet, she lands with meteoric force. Each creature within 20 feet of her must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet Keyleth fell. Keyleth still takes falling damage while in earth elemental form.

action.name: Chain Lightning
action.text: Keyleth casts chain lightning (spell save DC 22) from the Spire of Conflux at a creature she can see within 150 feet of her.

action.name: Wild Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: Keyleth magically polymorphs into a beast or elemental of CR 6 or lower. Her game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the new form, but she retains her alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. She also retains all of her skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the new form. She assumes the new form's hit points and Hit Dice and returns to the number of hit points she had when she reverts to her normal form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by her new form (her choice). She reverts to her humanoid form as a bonus action, or when she falls unconscious. Her attacks in Wild Shape form are magical, and she can cast spells while transformed.

action.name: Healing Word (4th Level) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Keyleth casts healing word, restoring 16 (4d4 + 6) hit points to herself or another creature she can see within 60 feet of her.

monster.spells: druidcraft, guidance, mending, cure wounds, faerie fire, fog cloud, healing word, thunderwave, alter self, flaming sphere, gust of wind, pass without trace, call lightning, wind wall, blight, control water, grasping vine, polymorph, stone shape, conjure elemental, greater restoration, scrying, wall of stone, heroes' feast, move earth, transport via plants, fire storm, plane shift, control weather, foresight, shapechange
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 263

monster.name: Kraghammer Goat-knight
monster.save: Str +5, Dex +1, Con +4, Int +2, Wis +2, Cha +5

trait.name: Aura of Protection
trait.text: Whenever the goat-knight or a creature friendly to it within 10 feet of it makes a saving throw, that creature gains a +2 bonus (included in the goat-knight's saving throws above). The goat-knight must be conscious to grant and gain this bonus.

trait.name: Divine Health
trait.text: The goat-knight is immune to disease.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
trait.text: The goat-knight has resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The goat-knight is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:
• 1st level (4 slots): bless, cure wounds, protection from evil and good, sanctuary, shield of faith • 2nd level (2 slots): branding smite, find steed, lesser restoration, zone of truth

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The goat-knight makes two warhammer attacks.

action.name: Warhammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

monster.spells: bless, cure wounds, protection from evil and good, sanctuary, shield of faith, branding smite, find steed, lesser restoration, zone of truth
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 246

monster.name: Mage Hunter Golem
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
monster.immune: poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Antimagic Cone
trait.text: The golem creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 60-foot cone originating from it. At the start of each of its turns, the golem decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the golem is subjected to a damage-dealing spell of 4th level or lower, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The golem uses its Antimagic Jolt and makes two melee attacks, or it makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claw (Recharge 5-6)
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or have a magic collar placed upon its neck.
While the target wears the collar, it is magically prevented from speaking and cannot cast any spell. A successful DC 25 Dexterity check using thieves' tools removes the collar.

action.name: Antimagic Jolt
action.text: Each creature within the golem's Antimagic Cone that has the ability to cast a spell of 1st level or higher must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 242

monster.name: Magma Landshark
monster.speed: walk 50 ft., burrow 50 ft., swim 50 ft. (lava only)

trait.name: Searing Presence
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the landshark takes 11 (2d10) fire damage.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The landshark's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The landshark sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 45 (6d12 + 6) piercing damage, and 14 (4d6) fire damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the landshark. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the landshark, and it takes 42 (12d6) fire damage at the start of each of the landshark's turns.
If the landshark takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the landshark must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the landshark. If the landshark dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

action.name: Deadly Leap
action.text: If the landshark jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a DC 18 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked prone and take 27 (6d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) fire damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked prone, and is pushed 5 feet out of the landshark's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls prone in the landshark's space.

action.name: Lava Pool (Recharge 6)
action.text: If the landshark is on solid ground, it melts the area around it, creating a pool of lava in a 10-foot radius. Any creature that starts its turn in the area or enters it for the first time on a turn takes 44 (8d10) fire damage.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 247

monster.name: Master Adranach
monster.languages: the languages spoken by its creator
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Arcane Leak
trait.text: When the adranach is reduced to half its hit point maximum (145 hit points), its mithral mask cracks and its arcane form begins to waver, creating a field of unstable magic around it. Any creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the adranach or enters that area for the first time on a turn takes 21 (6d6) radiant damage. Additionally, if a creature casts a spell within this area, it must make a DC 18 ability check using its spellcasting ability. On a failure, the spell backfires, consuming the spell slot and dealing 7 (2d6) force damage to the caster for each level of the spell slot that was consumed.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The adranach is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The adranach has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The adranach's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Colossal Build
trait.text: The adranach's carrying capacity is doubled, as is the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

trait.name: Slipstream
trait.text: The adranach can cast invisibility on itself at will. While it is invisible, its speed is doubled.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the adranach fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The adranach makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its tail.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, one target, reach 5 ft. Hit: 33 (4d12 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, one target, reach 15 ft. Hit: 20 (2d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Force Bolts (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The adranach targets up to six creatures it can see within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw or take 35 (10d6) force damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The adranach can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The adranach regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Claw Attack
legendary.text: The adranach makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Vanish (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The adranach casts invisibility and moves up to its walking or flying speed. (This movement doesn't benefit from its Slipstream trait.)

legendary.name: Starry Burst (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: A burst of astral energy flares from the adranach's body. Each creature within 60 feet of it must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 (5d10) force damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not blinded. The adranach then turns invisible until the start of its next turn or until it makes an attack.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 225

monster.name: Percival De Rolo

trait.name: Action Surge (2/Short Rest)
trait.text: Once on his turn, Percy can take one additional action.

trait.name: Cabal's Ruin
trait.text: Cabal's Ruin grants Percy advantage on saving throws against spells or magical effects. Additionally, Cabal's Ruin has 10 charges. When Percy hits with a weapon attack, he can expend up to 10 charges to have the attack deal 1d6 extra lightning damage per charge spent.

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Long Rest)
trait.text: Percy can reroll a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Misfire
trait.text: When Percy rolls a 2 or lower on the d20 when making an attack with Animus or Bad News, the attack misses and he can't use the weapon again until he spends an action to repair it. On a misfire with Animus, he takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

trait.name: No Mercy
trait.text: Percy's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20.

trait.name: Ranged Master
trait.text: Percy's ranged weapon attacks have a +2 bonus to hit (included in attacks), ignore half cover and three-quarters cover, and have no range penalty. Additionally, Percy can take a -5 penalty to any ranged attack roll to gain a +10 bonus to the damage roll.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Percy wears a ring of lightning resistance and Cabal's Ruin (see page 203). He wields Animus and Bad News, which are both +1 weapons.

trait.name: Quick Draw
trait.text: Percy adds his proficiency bonus to initiative rolls, giving him a +12 to initiative rolls.

trait.name: Toughness
trait.text: Percy has an additional 40 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text:
Percy makes four ranged attacks with Animus, or two ranged attacks with Bad News. When Percy hits with an attack with either weapon, he can choose one of the following additional effects:
Deadeye: Percy gains advantage on his next attack roll this turn made against the same target.
Disarm: The target must make a DC 20 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target drops one item it is holding of Percy's choice.

action.name: Animus
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, range 320 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage and 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Bad News
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, range 800 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Absorb Magic (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reaction.text: When Percy is targeted by an enemy's spell, he can absorb a portion of the spell's energy into Cabal's Ruin. The spell affects him normally, but the cloak gains a number of charges equal to the level of the spell. When he does so, he also gains resistance to one type of damage dealt by the spell until the end of his next turn.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 266

monster.name: Pike Trickfoot
monster.resist: fire; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
trait.text: Pike has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Pike wields a mace of disruption and wears gauntlets of ogre power, boots of speed, and the Plate of the Dawnmartyr.

trait.name: Dawnmartyr's Grace (1/Long Rest)
trait.text: When Pike is reduced to 0 hit points while wearing the Plate of the Dawnmartyr, she can choose to have a blast of healing flame surround her. She regains 1 hit point and is lifted to her feet. Each enemy within 10 feet of her takes 7 (2d6) fire damage or radiant damage (her choice).

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Pike is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame (4d8), spare the dying, thaumaturgy • 1st level (4 slots): command, cure wounds, guiding bolt, healing word, sanctuary, shield of faith • 2nd level (3 slots): aid, lesser restoration, spiritual weapon • 3rd level (3 slots): glyph of warding, mass healing word, protection from energy, revivify, speak with dead • 4th level (3 slots): death ward, freedom of movement, guardian of faith • 5th level (3 slots): flame strike, greater restoration, hallow, mass cure wounds, scrying • 6th level (2 slots): heal, heroes' feast, planar ally • 7th level (2 slots): resurrection • 8th level (1 slot): holy aura • 9th level (1 slot): mass heal

action.name: Mace of Disruption
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, plus an extra 7 (2d6) radiant damage if the target is a fiend or an undead. If the target has 25 hit points or fewer after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature becomes frightened of Pike until the end of her next turn.

action.name: Guiding Bolt (5th Level)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (8d6) radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against the target before the end of Pike's next turn has advantage.

action.name: Battle Priest (5/Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: If Pike uses the Attack action, she can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

action.name: Healing Word (4th Level) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Pike casts healing word, restoring 16 (4d4 + 6) hit points to herself or another creature she can see within 60 feet of her.

reaction.name: Dawnmartyr's Rebuke
reaction.text: When a creature within 5 feet of Pike hits her with a melee attack, she can deal 7 (2d6) fire or radiant damage to it (her choice).

reaction.name: Everlight's Guidance (3/Short Rest)
reaction.text: When Pike or a creature she can see within 30 feet of her makes an attack roll, she can grant a +10 bonus to the roll. She can grant this bonus after the roll is made but before it hits or misses.

monster.spells: light, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy, command, cure wounds, guiding bolt, healing word, sanctuary, shield of faith, aid, lesser restoration, spiritual weapon, glyph of warding, mass healing word, protection from energy, revivify, speak with dead, death ward, freedom of movement, guardian of faith, flame strike, greater restoration, hallow, mass cure wounds, scrying, heal, heroes' feast, planar ally, resurrection, holy aura, mass heal
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 269

monster.name: Plainscow
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacksSkills Insight +2

trait.name: Trampling Charge
trait.text: If the plainscow moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the plainscow can make another attack with its hooves as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 248

monster.name: Platinum Golem
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
monster.immune: acid, cold, fire, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Divine Custodian
trait.text: When the golem hits a creature with an opportunity attack, that creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The golem makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Radiant Blast (Recharge 6)
action.text: The golem emits a burst of radiant light in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in the area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and is not blinded.

reaction.name: Divine Judgment
reaction.text: When a creature within 10 feet of the golem makes an attack against a target other than the golem, the golem can make a mace attack against that creature.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 243

monster.name: Ravager Slaughter Lord

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The Slaughter Lord's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: thaumaturgy • 3/Day each: flame strike, spirit guardians • 1/Day each: control weather, divine word, fire storm

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If the Slaughter Lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While the Slaughter Lord is wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Slaughter Lord makes four attacks with its dual greatswords or three attacks with its spear.

action.name: Dual Greatswords
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage, or 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage if used with both hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Aggressive (Bonus Action)
action.text: The Slaughter Lord can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The Slaughter Lord can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Slaughter Lord regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The Slaughter Lord makes a spear or dual greatswords attack.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The Slaughter Lord moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The Slaughter Lord casts an innate spell.

monster.spells: thaumaturgy, flame strike, spirit guardians, control weather, divine word, fire storm
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 250

monster.name: Ravager Stabby-Stabber

trait.name: Stabby Frenzy
trait.text: When the stabby-stabber hits with a melee attack, it can attack again and continue making additional attacks until it misses. The stabby-stabber cannot move between the attacks made with this trait.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. Dagger: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Nimble Escape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The stabby-stabber can use the Disengage or Hide action.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 250

monster.name: Remnant Chosen

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The chosen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The chosen is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): chill touch (4d8), dancing lights, mage hand, message, shocking grasp (4d8) • 1st level (4 slots): charm person, mage armor, shield • 2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, detect thoughts • 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fly, hypnotic pattern • 4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility • 5th level (3 slots): dominate person, seeming • 6th level (1 slot): eyebite • 7th level (1 slot): finger of death • 8th level (1 slot): power word stun • 9th level (1 slot): power word kill

trait.name: Withering Spells
trait.text: When the chosen casts a spell of 1st level or higher, the next Withered Hand attack it makes before the end of its next turn deals extra damage equal to 1d6 per level of the spell cast.

action.name: Withering Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (5d6) force damage plus extra damage from the Withering Touch trait. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

action.name: Inescapable Sight (Bonus Action)
action.text: The Chosen selects a creature or object under the effect of an illusion spell of 4th level or lower. One illusion of the Chosen's choice affecting the target is dispelled.

monster.spells: chill touch, dancing lights, mage hand, message, shocking grasp, charm person, mage armor, shield, blindness/deafness, detect thoughts, counterspell, fly, hypnotic pattern, greater invisibility, dominate person, seeming, eyebite, finger of death, power word stun, power word kill
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 251

monster.name: Remnant Cultist

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The remnant cultist is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The cultist has the following wizard spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): chill touch (3d8), message, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost (3d8) • 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, hideous laughter, mage armor, shield • 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, suggestion • 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fear, vampiric touch • 4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, phantasmal killer • 5th level (2 slot): dream, mislead • 6th level (1 slot): circle of death

trait.name: Unknowable Secrets
trait.text: Any attempt to form a mental link with the cultist, cast scry on the cultist, or cast speak with dead on the cultist automatically fails, and the creature that initiated the attempt takes 21 (6d6) psychic damage.

trait.name: One-Eyed
trait.text: The cultist has disadvantage on any attack roll made against a target more than 30 feet away.

trait.name: Spellsteal
trait.text: If the cultist successfully uses counterspell to negate another creature's spell, it can cast the countered spell once before the end of its next turn using one of its spell slots of the same level or higher, and requiring no material components.

action.name: Dagger of Wounding
action.text:
Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. Hit points lost to this weapon's damage can be regained only through a short or long rest, rather than by regeneration, magic, or any other means.
Once per turn when the cultist hits a creature with an attack using this weapon, it can wound its target. At the start of each of the wounded creature's turns, it takes 2 (1d4) necrotic damage for each time it's been wounded by this weapon. It can then make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success. Alternatively, the wounded creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check, ending the effect of such wounds on it on a success.

monster.spells: chill touch, message, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost, detect magic, hideous laughter, mage armor, shield, detect thoughts, suggestion, counterspell, fear, vampiric touch, greater invisibility, phantasmal killer, dream, mislead, circle of death
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 252

monster.name: Rivermaw Brawler

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While the brawler is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The brawler makes three unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the brawler can choose one of the following additional effects:
• Bruise. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, its speed is reduced by 5 feet until it receives at least 1 point of magical healing. A creature can use its action to make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check to heal an affected creature within 5 feet of it (including itself), restoring any lost speed on a success.
• Disarm. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding. The brawler can choose which item is dropped, and can pick it up.
• Suplex. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reaction.name: Clever Fighter
reaction.text: When the brawler hits with an attack or is targeted by an attack, it can add its Intelligence modifier (+2) to its damage rolls or AC until the end of its turn.

reaction.name: Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reaction.text: When the brawler takes damage, it can reduce the damage by 8 (1d12 + 2).

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 254

monster.name: Rivermaw Stormborn

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of its turn, the stormborn can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The stormborn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). The stormborn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• 3/Day: lightning bolt • 1/Day: call lightning

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The stormborn makes two greataxe attacks. If it is concentrating on call lightning, it can also call down a lightning bolt.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

reaction.name: Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reaction.text: When the stormborn takes damage, it can reduce the damage by 10 (1d12 + 4).

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 254

monster.name: Scanlan Shorthalt
monster.save: Str +3, Dex +7, Con +5, Int +5, Wis +0, Cha +13

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
trait.text: Scanlan has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Focused
trait.text: Scanlan has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on spells.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Scanlan wields Mythcarver (see page 207), wears +2 studded leather armor of acid resistance and a ring of protection with a +2 bonus, and carries a hat of disguise and a wand of magic missiles.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Scanlan is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following bard spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): mage hand, message, minor illusion, vicious mockery • 1st level (4 slots): healing word, thunderwave • 2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, hold person, invisibility, suggestion • 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, lightning bolt, stinking cloud • 4th level (3 slots): dimension door, polymorph, Otiluke's resilient sphere • 5th level (3 slots): arcane hand, dominate person, modify memory, seeming • 6th level (2 slots): eyebite • 7th level (2 slots): magnificent mansion, reverse gravity • 8th level (1 slot): dominate monster • 9th level (1 slot): true polymorph

trait.name: Toughness
trait.text: Scanlan has an additional 40 hit points.

action.name: Mythcarver
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage and 3 (1d6) force damage.

action.name: Arcane Fist (8th Level) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 45 (10d8) force damage. Scanlan can use this bonus action only while concentrating on the arcane hand spell.

action.name: Bardic Inspiration (6/Short Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Scanlan grants a Bardic Inspiration die to one creature other than himself within 60 feet of him who can hear him. Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll a d12 and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. When Scanlan uses this ability, he gains advantage on attack rolls with Mythcarver until the end of his turn.

action.name: Healing Word (5th Level) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Scanlan casts healing word, restoring 18 (5d4 + 6) hit points to himself or another creature he can see within 60 feet of him.

reaction.name: Cutting Words
reaction.text: When a creature Scanlan can see within 60 feet of him makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a damage roll, he can expend a use of Bardic Inspiration to roll a d12 and subtract the number rolled from the creature's roll. The creature also has disadvantage on its next saving throw.

monster.spells: mage hand, message, minor illusion, vicious mockery, healing word, thunderwave, blindness/deafness, hold person, invisibility, suggestion, counterspell, lightning bolt, stinking cloud, dimension door, polymorph, Otiluke's resilient sphere, Bigby's hand, dominate person, modify memory, seeming, eyebite, magnificent mansion, reverse gravity, dominate monster, true polymorph
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 271

monster.name: Taryon Darrington
monster.speed: walk 40 ft., fly 50 ft. (with broom of flying)

trait.name: Alchemical Defense
trait.text: Tary's experimental concoctions have granted him resistance to acid and poison damage, and immunity to the poisoned condition.

trait.name: Doty
trait.text: Doty moves and acts on Tary's turn, and Tary can use a bonus action to command him to use the Dash, Dodge, Disengage, or Attack action. He can also command him to Attack as part of his Multitask action (see below). Doty can take only one action on each of Tary's turns.

trait.name: Focused
trait.text: Tary has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on spells.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Tary wears a helm of brilliance, a robe of useful items, and a ring of the ram. He carries a rod of mercurial form (see page 197), as well as a bag of holding, 1d4 + 4 beads of force, a broom of flying, and a chime of opening.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Tary is a 15th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): mending, prestidigitation, ray of frost (3d8) • 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, heroism, identify, shield • 2nd level (3 slots): alter self, branding smite, see invisibility, warding bond • 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, fly, haste, magic circle, revivify • 4th level (2 slots): banishment, fabricate, fire shield

trait.name: Toughness
trait.text: Tary has an additional 30 hit points.

action.name: Multitask
action.text: Tary makes two weapon attacks or casts a spell with a casting time of 1 action, and can also command Doty to use his Empowered Fist or Repair action.

action.name: Mercurial Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage.

action.name: Bead of Force
action.text: Tary throws a bead of force up to 60 feet. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of where the bead landed must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 12 (5d4) force damage. A sphere of transparent force then encloses the area for 1 minute. A creature that fails the save and is completely within the area is trapped inside the sphere.

reaction.name: Brilliant Intellect
reaction.text: When Tary or another creature he can see within 30 feet of him makes an ability check or a saving throw, he can use his reaction to add +4 to the roll.

monster.spells: mending, prestidigitation, ray of frost, detect magic, heroism, identify, shield, alter self, branding smite, see invisibility, warding bond, dispel magic, fly, haste, magic circle, revivify, banishment, fabricate, fire shield
monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 273

monster.name: Trinket
monster.languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Chosen Companion
trait.text: Trinket has an additional 10 hit points, and has a +6 bonus to attack and damage rolls and to Wisdom (Perception) checks.

trait.name: Empowered Attacks
trait.text: Trinket's attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to damage from nonmagical attacks.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: Trinket has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Raven's Slumber
trait.text: If Trinket is reduced to 0 hit points and is within 100 feet of Vex, he is immediately drawn into the demiplane within Vex's raven's slumber and stabilized.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Trinket makes two attacks: one with his bite and one with his claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (1d8 + 10) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d6 + 10) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting: Reborn p. 266

monster.name: Vex'ahlia
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., fly 50 ft. (with broom of flying)
monster.save: Str +6, Dex +13, Con +3, Int +4, Wis +5, Cha +5
monster.languages: Abyssal, Common, Draconic, Elvish, thieves' cant, Undercommon

trait.name: Assassinate
trait.text: During her first turn, Vex has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit Vex scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If Vex is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Vex has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Ranged Master
trait.text: Vex's ranged weapon attacks have a +2 bonus to hit (included in attacks), and ignore half cover and three-quarters cover, and have no range penalty. Additionally, Vex can take a -5 penalty to any ranged attack roll to gain a +10 bonus to the damage roll.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
trait.text: Vex deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Vex that isn't incapacitated and she doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Vex wears +2 studded white dragon leather armor of cold resistance and a ring of protection with a +2 bonus. She carries a broom of flying and a raven's slumber (see page 197), and wields Fenthras (see page 205).

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
